name: El Salvador
description: El Salvador, meaning 'River of Silver,' is a small but incredibly diverse country located in the heart of Central America. Known as the 'Land of Volcanoes,' it boasts a rich history, vibrant culture, and stunning natural landscapes ranging from lush rainforests and towering volcanoes to beautiful Pacific beaches. Despite facing significant challenges, El Salvador is working to preserve its natural heritage and promote sustainable tourism.

quickFacts.label: Capital
quickFacts.description: The bustling capital city and political center of El Salvador.
quickFacts.detail: San Salvador is situated on a volcanic slope and offers a mix of colonial architecture and modern development.

quickFacts.label: Population
quickFacts.description: El Salvador has a relatively high population density.
quickFacts.detail: The majority of the population lives in urban areas, particularly around the capital.

quickFacts.label: Area
quickFacts.description: El Salvador is one of the smallest countries in Central America.
quickFacts.detail: It's roughly the size of Rhode Island in the United States.

quickFacts.label: Official Language
quickFacts.description: Spanish is the official language and is widely spoken.
quickFacts.detail: Indigenous languages, such as Nahuatl and Cacaoteco, are also spoken in certain regions.

quickFacts.label: Currency
quickFacts.description: The US Dollar is the official currency.
quickFacts.detail: El Salvador was the second country to adopt the Bitcoin as legal tender in 2021, though its use remains limited.

quickFacts.label: GDP
quickFacts.description: El Salvador's economy is largely based on agriculture and services.
quickFacts.detail: Tourism is a growing sector, particularly in coastal areas.

climateData.title: Climate of El Salvador
climateData.description: El Salvador experiences a tropical monsoon climate, characterized by distinct wet and dry seasons. The Pacific coast is generally warmer and more humid than the highlands.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Dry Season
seasonalCharacteristics.description: The dry season is the most popular time to visit, with sunny skies and lower humidity.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Wet Season
seasonalCharacteristics.description: The wet season brings heavy rainfall, particularly on the Pacific coast. However, it also results in lush vegetation and vibrant landscapes.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Hurricane Season
seasonalCharacteristics.description: El Salvador is susceptible to hurricanes and tropical storms during this period.

naturalWonders.name: Ilamatepec Volcano
naturalWonders.description: Ilamatepec Volcano is the highest peak in El Salvador, offering breathtaking panoramic views of the surrounding landscape. It's a challenging but rewarding climb for experienced hikers.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The volcano is a dormant stratovolcano composed of layers of lava and ash. The summit offers stunning vistas of Lake Coatepeque and the Pacific coast.
viewingTips: Start early in the morning to avoid the heat
Bring plenty of water and snacks

naturalWonders.name: El Boquerón National Park
naturalWonders.description: El Boquerón is a collapsed volcanic crater that forms a stunning lake. It's a popular destination for hiking and birdwatching.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The crater formed after a massive eruption in 1922, creating a deep depression filled with water. The surrounding area is covered in lush vegetation.
viewingTips: Take a boat trip on the lake

naturalWonders.name: Lake Coatepeque
naturalWonders.description: Lake Coatepeque is a beautiful freshwater lake surrounded by volcanoes and lush forests. It's a popular spot for water sports and relaxation.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The lake is fed by underground springs and is known for its clear, turquoise waters. It's a vital source of water for the region.

ecosystemData.title: Ecosystems of El Salvador
ecosystemData.overview: El Salvador’s diverse ecosystems range from tropical rainforests to dry deciduous forests and coastal wetlands. These ecosystems support a rich array of plant and animal life.

biodiversityCategories.name: Tropical Rainforest
biodiversityCategories.description: El Salvador’s rainforests are home to a vast array of plant and animal species, including many endemic species.

statistics.details: A significant portion are endemic to El Salvador.

notableSpecies.name: Red-Eyed Tree Frog
notableSpecies.significance: A flagship species for rainforest conservation.

notableSpecies.name: Salvadoran Horned Frog
notableSpecies.significance: Critically endangered due to habitat loss.

biodiversityCategories.name: Dry Forest
biodiversityCategories.description: Dry forests are found in the northern and western parts of El Salvador, characterized by drought-resistant vegetation.

notableSpecies.name: Jaguar
notableSpecies.significance: A top predator in the dry forest ecosystem.

activities.title: Outdoor Activities in El Salvador
activities.description: El Salvador offers a wide range of outdoor activities for all skill levels, from hiking and water sports to birdwatching and cultural tours.

activityCategories.name: Hiking
activityCategories.description: Explore El Salvador’s stunning volcanoes, rainforests, and cloud forests on foot.

activities.name: Ilamatepec Volcano Hike
activities.description: A challenging hike to the summit of El Salvador’s highest volcano.
activities.requirements: Sturdy hiking boots, water, snacks, sunscreen

activities.name: El Boquerón Crater Hike
activities.description: A scenic hike around the rim of the El Boquerón crater lake.

activityCategories.name: Water Sports
activityCategories.description: Enjoy swimming, surfing, kayaking, and snorkeling in El Salvador’s beautiful coastal waters.

activities.name: Surfing at Playa El Tunco
activities.description: El Tunco is a popular surfing spot with consistent waves.

activities.name: Kayaking on Lake Coatepeque
activities.description: Explore the beautiful Lake Coatepeque by kayak.

clothing.winter: Layers of clothing, jacket, sweater, long pants
